issue.title: [8.0.0] Bazel always errors with bad `--client_env` on Windows for HEAD Bazel

milestone.title: 8.0.0 release blockers
milestone.description: Issues that should be fixed before 8.0.0 release.

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

body:
Current suspect is https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/1744d45c0c57af23f631c2145e8af4b185dca77f. But it's hard to revert since there's subsequent dependent commits...

cc @fmeum

OK, I can confirm that reverting that commit and all its dependents (in order: 27487cf11f61eb23108f8df129dc1a00ee1a4370, ed38e471431fc81628490ab37611dc09c5bbec9e, fd33eccd27b36f2b0078e52d99c8af7110c06bad, 62493bda06cc1db3d4fb03faa8ac96b42b70820a, 2733cffd85032012e9a798b5ea814eeaf1e34ebe) makes the problem go away on the release-8.0.0 branch.

It's getting late in the day, so we're not going to push rc3 today. Which means I won't try to actually revert those; let's do a fix forward tomorrow, if possible (or at worst, a small Windows-focused rollback).

Seems to me that the problem is somewhere in https://cs.opensource.google/bazel/bazel/+/master:src/main/cpp/option_processor_windows.cc;l=75-92;drc=1744d45c0c57af23f631c2145e8af4b185dca77f (since that's the part that changed in that commit), but I don't understand enough to be certain.

issue.title: Do not forward legacy `cmd.exe` variables to the server

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This fixes startup failures such as:
```
ERROR: While parsing option --client_env==C:=C:\Users\wyv: Variable definitions must be in the form of a 'name=value' assignment
```

Fixes #24448

body:
As it turns out, `GetEnvironmentStrings` (newly used in the culprit) returns [special enviroment variables set by `cmd.exe`](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20100506-00/?p=14133) whose names start with `=`. `env` and the previously used `environ` appear to render the `=` as `!` for POSIX compliance.

I am trying to reproduce this crash in an integration test. We can probably just skip over these variables, but if I can find a way to pass them to Bazel as is, that's also an option.

OK, I also looked into why our CI didn't catch it, because we run `bazel info` for every job before the actual build & test.

Looks like `=C:` doesn't show up in Python's `os.environ` and env was overridden at 
https://github.com/bazelbuild/continuous-integration/blob/721d577d934ba717f3aaa16baf33bd43349d3b6f/buildkite/bazelci.py#L2648, if I comment out this line, I could reproduce this on CI.

I guess the best way is to just ignore it this weird env var.
I will do that and then we can merge https://github.com/bazelbuild/continuous-integration/pull/2116.

issue.title: [8.0.0] Do not forward legacy `cmd.exe` variables to the server

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
This fixes startup failures such as:
```
ERROR: While parsing option --client_env==C:=C:\Users\wyv: Variable definitions must be in the form of a 'name=value' assignment
```

Fixes #24448

Closes #24451.

PiperOrigin-RevId: 699115724
Change-Id: Id7a2445e82b24384e9ade0c92ddb343f00e9ab2b

Commit https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/commit/59eb5192bc06f50192a3bd442ba170001b7127c2

body:
A fix for this issue has been included in [Bazel 8.0.0 RC3](https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/releases/tag/8.0.0rc3). Please test out the release candidate and report any issues as soon as possible.
If you're using Bazelisk, you can point to the latest RC by setting USE_BAZEL_VERSION=8.0.0rc3. Thanks!
